thread.title: Uganda says 12 of its soldiers killed in Islamist attack in Somalia
thread.title_full: Uganda says 12 of its soldiers killed in Islamist attack in Somalia | News24

author: news24.com
title: Uganda says 12 of its soldiers killed in Islamist attack in Somalia
text:
Kampala - Twelve Ugandan soldiers who served as African Union peacekeepers were killed when militants attacked their base in Somalia this week, a Ugandan military spokesperson said on Thursday.
The statement suggests a lower death toll than the 70 claimed by al Shabaab, which carried out Tuesday's attack, although spokesperson Paddy Ankunda said he could not confirm if peacekeepers of other nationalities had been killed.
The AU peacekeeping mission, known as Amisom, has not yet released casualty figures for Tuesday's attack, which came roughly a year after al Shabaab leader Ahmed Abdi Godane was killed in a US air strike.
"We won't relent in our efforts to pacify Somalia, it's a mission we must accomplish no matter what," Ankunda told Reuters after announcing that the bodies of the 12 Ugandan soldiers would be flown home this week.
